intro: Uvifera tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered uvifera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Its leaves are finely divided and have a fern-like appearance, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white. Uvifera tenuiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
